title: SunCable signs 70-year multi-million-dollar agreement with NT traditional owners | ABC NEWS
description: An ambitious and massive solar project aiming to harness the outback sun to power parts of Australia and Asia has taken a major step forward. After a years-long negotiation Aboriginal land owners from the Northern Territory's Barkly region have signed a 70-year agreement giving the Sun Cable project the go ahead. Matt Garrick travelled to the NT town of Elliott around 750 kilometres south of Darwin for ABC News Northern Territory. title: More schools to reopen in Canberra as coloured sand clean-up continues | ABC NEWS
description: The clean-up and disposal of coloured sand, possibly contaminated with asbestos, continues across the country, with dozens of schools closed in the ACT, Tasmania and South Australia. In the ACT, dozens of schools reopened, but 25 remained closed and 16 were partially closed. The types of asbestos detected in the sand have been tremolite and chrysotile, both of which were in states unlikely to form fibres and therefore were considered "very low risk". title: Why billions was wiped off the ASX in a single day | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: The share market has had it sharpest fall since the fallout from Donald Trump's so-called Liberation Day tariffs.  $59 billion has been wiped off the market value of the ASX. The sell off was sparked in tech, with the sector losing six per cent.  Miners finished down for the third consecutive day, and banks also weighed heavily on the market. ABC's Business Correspondent David Taylor joins Kirsten Aiken to explain the day's movements. He spoke to Markets Today senior portfolio manager Henry Jennings who told him he expects the selling to continue. #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-11-18/asx-market-sump-worst-since-liberation-day-tariffs-nov-16/106020676  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Crown VS State: how Tonga's royal past shaped its democratic future | ABC NEWS
description: It's been 15 years since Tonga introduced democratic reforms, but tensions are still flaring between the crown and state. With the elections just around the corner, reporter Marian Kupu takes a closer look at the Kingdom's democracy movement. title: The deadly protest crackdown that led to Sheikh Hasina's death sentence | ABC NEWS
description: Bangladeshi reporter Zyma Islam recounts the deadly crackdown on student-led protests that informed the death sentence for the country's ousted prime minister, Sheikh Hasina. title: Victorian Liberals elect Jess Wilson following leadership spill | ABC NEWS
description: For the first time in Victoria's history, women will lead the major parties into a state election after Jess Wilson toppled Opposition Leader Brad Battin today in yet another Liberal party coup.  The rookie MP from Kew also becomes the Coalition's first-ever female leader, but faces a monumental challenge to unify her party and take on a dominant labor in just 12 months time.  She's the third Liberal leader in just 11 months and has vowed to switch the opposition's focus away from crime.  State political reporter Richard Willingham begins our coverage. title: TPG says outdated Samsung software behind fatal Triple Zero call failure | ABC NEWS
description: Mobile provider TPG has confirmed a Sydney customer died after they couldn't contact emergency services. The telco says the caller's Samsung phone was operating incompatible software that couldn't connect to Triple Zero. Although TPG says it previously warned customers using affected Samsung devices to update their software, some experts say the issue could have been better communicated. title: Japan deploys barking drones to keep bears at bay as attacks increase | The World | ABC NEWS
description: It's an unorthodox solution to a very serious problem. Over the last eight months Japan has seen 13 people killed and hundreds more injured due to a spike in bear attacks. After considering a number of different options, one city is deploying what it hopes is its best line of defence - a drone that barks. Manny Tsigas reports. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Thousands in Philippine capital hold second day of anti-graft protests | The World | ABC NEWS
description: More than 200,000 people have been taking to the streets of the Philippines to protest against government corruption and the misuse of flood-mitigation funds. The country has been hit by a raft of powerful storms in recent weeks, which have exposed long-term issues with disaster management systems. Political science professor Ronald Holmes tells The World the protests are unlikely to subside until the government "shows proof they are sincere" about getting to the bottom of "these corrupt activities". #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: What was Amelia Earhart's last message before disappearing? | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The Trump administration has released thousands of files related to renowned aviator Amelia Earhart, who vanished in 1937 during her attempt to become the first woman to circumnavigate the world. The Director of National Intelligence said the release was about "finding and telling the truth", though many experts say the information was already widely available. Laurie Gwen Shapiro - a filmmaker, journalist and author who has spent years researching Amelia Earhart's life - tells The World the release of the documents was "conveniently timed". #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad.
